comments:
Build ID: I20070625-1500

Steps To Reproduce:
1.start eclipse (on mac, uses default install options)
2.open text resource
3.select resource
4.right click once
5.select refresh
6.select same resource if not still highlit
7.right click once
8.menu items are missing
9.mouse up and down menu clears remaining menu items.
10. exit eclipse.


More information:
running mac os x 10.4.9, default Java from Apple.
running subclipse 1.2.4 from tigris.org.
mac is a mac pro with intel machine.

here is the error log related to this bug:

symptoms change.
mousing over the vertical popup menu when select/right mouse click on a file may cause the entries in the popup menu to disappear, but may not, even after it happens once.  Sometimes it takes scrolling up and down a couple of times to make it happen.  Even then, going to a different file will not necessarily cause the behavior to repeat.

5-run ControlExample.java with this result:

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.Error: Unresolved compilation problems:

-------------
without visibility into the .classpath in the resource or java perspective, it is difficult to see what to do next.

The ".*" are hidden by default in the java perspective. The instructions I sent are out of date for Eclipse 3.3. Sorry I did not see that. You need to change the view filters to show ".*" resources. In the "Package Explorer" of the "Java perspective", there is a toolbar in the top with one button that looks like a "triangle". If you select that button a menu will pop up with a menu option called "Filters".

Created an attachment (id=78652)
screen shot of filters menu option

..examples.ole.win32 only works on Windows. Just delete it.

The next step is to self-host eclipse (after applying the patch). Select the org.eclispe.swt project, right-click to popup menu, select "Run As -> Eclipse Application". Try to reproduce the problem and if it happens, attach the output that goes in the outer eclipse console view.

Sorry, I did not see your other comment.

If you have some time to kill :-). You could reinstall wordDump and try to reproduce it again. Anyway, I will close it as WORKSFORME. Please reopen it you still reproduce it.
